intro: Bellevalia montana, commonly known as the mountain bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of Europe. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes, often in mountainous areas. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in a fine, hairy coating. Bellevalia montana is known for its resilience to cold climates and is often found in alpine meadows and scree slopes.
